Package algorithm

This package includes all information encapsulation techniques.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractAlgorithm
    All encapsulation algorithms have to extend this abstract class.
    BagItPackaging
    This Plug-In uses the BagIt implemenation from Richard Rodgers for integrating BagIt into PeriCAT.
    F5Steganography
    This Plug-In uses the F5 implementation from cgaffga based on Andreas Westfelds work.
    ImageImageFrameExpanding
    This technique works similar to closing credits of a movie, but for images.
    ImageInformationEmbeddingFrame
    This technique works similar to closing credits of a movie, but for images.
    JPEGTextAdding
    This method adds text at the end of a JPEG file.
    MetsSubmissionInformationPackage
    This plug-In uses the harvard METS implementation to create simple METS SIPs.
    OaiOreSubmissionInformationPackage
    This plug-In uses the DSPACE implementation of OAI-ORE to create a simple package of this format.
    OpenStegoRandomLSBSteganography
    This plug-In uses the random LSB algorithm from the Open Stego tool.
    PDFFileAttacher
    This class uses the pdfbox library to attach files to pdfs.
    PNGChunkAdding
    This technique uses the PNGJ library to embed additional information chunks into PNG files.
    QRCodeWatermarking
    The ZXing library is used to implement this technique.
    TarPackaging
    Tar packaging is implemented using the apache commons library.
    TextInformationFrame
    This algorithm simply adds a payload text section to text files.
    ZipPackaging
    Zip packaging is implemented using the apache commons library.

Package algorithm Description

This package includes all information encapsulation techniques. They extend the class AbstractAlgorithm. If you want to plug-in your information encapsulation technique in the PeriCAT framework, then implement it similar to the existing techniques extending the abstract algorithm base class. Afterwards add your class to the list of available techniques at the Configuration class.
